title: Drift: Implement contract lock/verify CLI commands (00-053-06)
notes:
**Workstream:** 00-053-06 (sdp-ie25.7)
**Status:** Stub implementations only

**Current State:**
- runContractLock() prints 'not yet implemented'
- runContractVerify() prints 'not yet implemented'
- No lock file creation logic
- No verification logic

**Required:**
1. Implement lock file creation (.contracts/{feature}.lock)
2. Calculate SHA256 hash of contract
3. Store git SHA, timestamp, checksum
4. Implement verify command (compare hash vs lock)
5. Add --force flag for re-locking
6. Unit tests (LockCmd, VerifyCmd)
7. Integration test (lock → tamper → verify fails)

**Acceptance:**
- sdp contract lock --feature=telemetry --sha=abc123 creates lock file
- sdp contract verify --feature=telemetry returns exit code 0 (match) or 1 (mismatch)
- Tests ≥80% coverage
- File <200 LOC

**Estimated:** 2-3 hours

**Reference:** docs/workstreams/backlog/00-053-06.md
close_reason: Implemented contract lock/verify commands with full test coverage. All acceptance criteria met.

title: Drift: Refactor code_analyzer.go into separate parser files (00-053-01)
notes:
**Workstream:** 00-053-01 (sdp-ie25.2)
**Status:** Architectural violation - monolithic implementation

**Current State:**
- code_analyzer.go: 448 LOC (exceeds 200 LOC guideline)
- All parser logic in single file (Go, TS, Python parsers)
- src/sdp/contract/parsers/ directory exists but empty

**Plan Specification:**
- Create src/sdp/contract/parsers/go_parser.go
- Create src/sdp/contract/parsers/python_parser.go
- Create src/sdp/contract/parsers/ts_parser.go

**Required:**
1. Extract Go backend parser to go_parser.go
2. Extract TypeScript parser to ts_parser.go
3. Extract Python SDK parser to python_parser.go
4. Update code_analyzer.go to import and use parsers
5. Ensure each file <200 LOC
6. Maintain test coverage ≥80%
7. Update imports in code_analyzer_test.go

**Acceptance:**
- 3 parser files created in src/sdp/contract/parsers/
- code_analyzer.go reduced to <200 LOC
- All tests still passing
- Coverage maintained

**Estimated:** 3-4 hours

**Reference:** docs/workstreams/backlog/00-053-01.md

title: Feature F051: SDP Long-term Memory System
Add @deploy to @oneshot workflow
description: Add deployment step to oneshot orchestrator after quality review. Modify orchestrator.md and oneshot/SKILL.md

title: Create notification gateway system
description: Severity-based routing. Channels: Desktop (immediate), Email (deferred), CLI digest. Skip Slack for now. Actionable notifications with resume commands.

title: Implement drift detection system
description: Golden master + semantic diff. Extract expected/actual state. LLM-powered semantic analysis. CLI: sdp drift detect. Blocks deployment if drift > threshold. Prevents 13% friction.

title: Add checkpoint to @feature before agents
description: Add information quality check before spawning discovery agents. AskUserQuestion if description is vague (<200 words, multiple interpretations)

title: Clarify @feature vs @oneshot in documentation
description: Update CLAUDE.md with decision tree. Clarify @feature=planning, @oneshot=execution. Add clear mental model

title: Refactor @feature to orchestrate @idea/@design
description: Remove duplicate interview logic from @feature. Delegate to Skill('@idea') and Skill('@design'). Reduce to ~100 LOC orchestration layer

title: Implement event-sourced agent coordination
description: Add immutable event log + state machine replay. Events: STARTED, DECISION, COMPLETED, FAILED. Audit trail for post-mortem. Prevents drift, enables context resume.

title: Implement dynamic agent role switching
description: RBAC + capability safety. Agent roles: ORCHESTRATOR, BUILDER, REVIEWER, HUMAN_PROXY. Auto-switch on >2 failures. Safety rails for critical decisions.

title: Implement continuous requirement verification
description: Binary probes from intent.json. Run after each workstream. Detect drift immediately. Prevents 13% friction (doc-code mismatch). CLI: sdp verify --continuous

title: Enhance checkpoint with snapshots and rollback
description: CQRS + snapshotting. Time travel: rollback to any checkpoint. Branching: fork execution paths. Merge parallel results. Minimal storage (append-only events).

title: Implement parallel workstream execution
description: Work-stealing + dependency graph. 3-5x speedup for 5+ workstreams. Fault tolerant. Deterministic execution. Kahn's algorithm implementation.

title: DevOps: Add contract command unit tests
description: Add unit tests for CLI contract commands in cmd/sdp/contract_test.go. Test flag parsing, error handling, and command execution. Target: 80% coverage for contract commands.

title: DevOps: Update CI/CD Go version from 1.21 to 1.24
description: Update .github/workflows/ci.yml and .github/workflows/release.yml to use Go 1.24+ to match go.mod version (1.24.2). Current mismatch (CI: 1.21, go.mod: 1.24.2) may cause build failures.

title: Drift: Reduce agent file sizes to meet AI-readiness guidelines
notes:
**Feature:** F053 (Component Contract Validation)
**Quality Gate:** Files must be <200 LOC

**Violations:**
1. synthesis_agent.go: 399 LOC (target: <200)
2. code_analyzer.go: 448 LOC (target: <200)
3. contract_generator.go: 368 LOC (target: <200)
4. contract_validator.go: 369 LOC (target: <200)

**Why This Matters:**
- AI-readiness principle: Small files = better LLM comprehension
- Files >200 LOC reduce agent effectiveness
- Violates SDP quality gates (RULES_COMMON.md)

**Required:**
1. Refactor synthesis_agent.go into 2 files (synthesis_agent.go, synthesis_rules.go)
2. Refactor code_analyzer.go (already tracked in sdp-16i)
3. Refactor contract_generator.go into 2 files (generator.go, openapi_generator.go)
4. Refactor contract_validator.go into 2 files (validator.go, contract_differ.go)
5. Ensure all files <200 LOC
6. Maintain test coverage

**Acceptance:**
- All files <200 LOC
- Tests still passing
- No functionality loss
- Coverage maintained ≥80%

**Estimated:** 4-5 hours

**Reference:** RULES_COMMON.md - Quality Gates

title: DevOps: Decide .contracts directory git strategy
description: Decide whether to track or ignore .contracts/ directory. If tracking (source of truth): add to git. If ignoring (generated artifacts): add to .gitignore. Document decision in CONTRIBUTING.md.
